intro: Heteropterys gayana f. typica, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and appear in clusters. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
